update.description:

This should support both ffmpeg2 and ffmpeg3.

Should resolve issue #2002.

content.raw:
I'm seeing these warnings on startup:

~~~
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:107] Object::connect: No such signal gazebo::gui::VideoRecorder::recordingStarted()
[Wrn] [GuiIface.cc:107] Object::connect: No such signal gazebo::gui::VideoRecorder::recordingStopped()
~~~

content.raw:
here's my comment from pull request #2423:

should we also enable the video record button in the [TopToolbar](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/8f65af9d519d70e03a8f7ea99f669d140001d7d3/gazebo/gui/TopToolbar.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#TopToolbar.cc-186) in model editor?

update.description:
Record user camera to a video file using an icon in the GUI toolbar.

This should support both ffmpeg2 and ffmpeg3.

update.title: Video recorder

content.raw: Please make an issue for this.
Reminder: please make changes this directly.

Suggestion: pre-fill the dialog with the file extension. I often forget what I clicked on when I started recording. 

It might also be nice to let the user know the extension while recording, maybe in the record button's tooltip? "Recording MP4 video..."
content.html:
Suggestion: pre-fill the dialog with the file extension. I often forget what I clicked on when I started recording.

It might also be nice to let the user know the extension while recording, maybe in the record button's tooltip? "Recording MP4 video..."

content.raw: When I click to record AVI gzclient crashes. [Here](https://bitbucket.org/snippets/chapulina/b4XRB)'s a backtrace. I'm on Trusty and it looks like I don't have ffmpeg installed. Recording MP4 and OGV works.
content.html: When I click to record AVI gzclient crashes. Here's a backtrace. I'm on Trusty and it looks like I don't have ffmpeg installed. Recording MP4 and OGV works.

content.raw: I don't want to install it.

content.raw: There are no assumptions placed on the filename. An extension is not needed, and a full path is not needed. The filename can be anything the user wants.
content.html: There are no assumptions placed on the filename. An extension is not needed, and a full path is not needed. The filename can be anything the user wants.

content.raw: Do we need the `_white` in the filename?
content.html: Do we need the _white in the filename?

content.raw: Just out of curiosity, why isn't this with `qt_headers`?
content.html: Just out of curiosity, why isn't this with qt_headers?

content.raw: Suggestion: it would be nice to specify if this is the full path, just the filename, including extension...
content.html: Suggestion: it would be nice to specify if this is the full path, just the filename, including extension...

Hombrew looks good

Nvidia trusty good

Trusty no gpu :large_blue_circle:

content.raw: This looks like #2002 isn't an issue for the new code in `VideoEncoder`, but there are still hidden warnings in `AudioDecoder` and `Video` that were disabled by pull request #2388, so I don't think this completely fixes #2002 yet
content.html: This looks like #2002 isn't an issue for the new code in VideoEncoder, but there are still hidden warnings in AudioDecoder and Video that were disabled by pull request #2388, so I don't think this completely fixes #2002 yet
